title: Hypotheses
text: What are the Null Hypothesis $$H_0$$ and Alternative Hypothesis in this context?

hintAnswer: $$H_0$$: Surveyed obese fit the distribution of expected obese
title: Null Hypothesis
text: Choose the answer from the following.
choices: $$H_0$$: Surveyed obese fit the distribution of expected obese
$$H_0$$: Surveyed obese do not fit the distribution of expected obese

hintAnswer: $$H_a$$: Surveyed obese do not fit the distribution of expected obese
title: Alternative Hypothesis
text: Choose the answer from the following.
choices: $$H_a$$: Surveyed obese fit the distribution of expected obese
$$H_a$$: Surveyed obese do not fit the distribution of expected obese

title: Consider what distribution is most appropriate to use in this problem.
What is the degree of freedom?
Compute the p-value.
text: Round the answer to three decimal places.

title: Compare with the significant level 0.05.
text: At 5% significance level, \alpha $$=$$ 0.05. For this data, P < \alpha. Reject the null hypothesis.

title: Interpret the Result
text: At the 5% level of significance, from the data, there is sufficient evidence to conclude that the surveyed obese do not fit the distribution of expected obese.
